item.title: Dayna add a quote by Benjamin Hale
item.description: "...we, and I mean humans, are meaning makers. We do not discover the meanings of mysterious things, we invent them. We make meanings because meaninglessness terrifies us above all things. More than snakes, even. More than falling, or the dark. We trick ourselves into seeing meanings in things, when in fact all we are doing is grafting our meanings onto the universe to comfort ourselves. We gild the chaos of the universe with our symbols. To admit that something is meaningless is just like falling backward into darkness." (p184)" -- Benjamin Hale

item.title: Dayna add a quote by Benjamin Hale
item.description: "If you ever have children, tell them they must always be drunk. Drunk on love, drunk on poetry, drunk on wine, it doesnâ€™t matter. This world is too goddamn painful to waste a second of your existence sober." -- Benjamin Hale
